intro: Hippocrepis scorpioides var. nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada scorpionvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, trifoliate leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
